hints.pageTime: Loading a page takes about 0.2 seconds → 100 pages ≈ 20 seconds → 1000 pages ≈ 200 seconds (≈ 3:20 minutes).

investedTokens.walletCapInfo: Note: A wallet can hold a maximum of 1000 trust lines.

history.hintFullHistory: Note: The ledger history from the Horizon server only goes back to {{available}}. Data is displayed only up to that point. Therefore, the chosen "From" date is limited. For older data, a (usually paid) full-history provider is required (possibly coming in the future!).

multisigCreate.activateHint: Activation is necessary for the account to exist. In the testnet, this can be done via Friendbot, and in the mainnet, via "Create Account" from an existing wallet.
multisigCreate.balanceWarning: The starting balance is likely too low to add the {{count}} additional signers (minimum reserve: {{req}} XLM)

bestPractices.text: Recommended: 2 out of 3 signatures. This means that out of a total of 3 authorized signatories (1 Master + 2 Signers), at least 2 signatures are required. Implementation: Set the weights for Master/Signer to 1 each and set the thresholds to low=1, medium=2, high=2. This allows simple changes with 1 signature; payments/trades require 2; security-critical changes require 2.
bestPractices.title: Proven settings

multisigCreate.confirmLowBalance: Initial balance ({{bal}} XLM) is below the minimum reserve ({{req}} XLM) for {{count}} additional signers. Continue anyway?
multisigCreate.createdNoSigners: Account created. No additional signers were specified.
multisigCreate.hint: Create a new wallet. Optionally activate immediately (1 XLM or recommended) and add additional signers (Multisig).

info.multisig: Multisig means: Multiple signatures are required for this account. You select additional signers and the threshold (e.g., 2 out of 3). A transaction is only valid if at least as many signatures are present as the threshold (Master + co-signers).
info.text:
How it works
Your private key always stays in your browser. It is only used to sign your transaction locally. Only the completed signature is sent to our server or externally, never your key. Anyone who wants can verify this with the developer tools in the browser: it shows that no key is being transmitted.

instructions.public: Public Key: Your account address, like an IBAN. Safe to share.
instructions.secret: Secret Key: Your password for the account. Never share it, store securely (e.g., on paper).

multisigCreate.mainnetActivateNote: Note: Additional reserves are needed for multisig. 1 XLM is often not enough.
multisigCreate.menuHint: To create accounts for family members, friends, employees...
multisigCreate.signersCountHint: You set the minimum number of signatures below under "Required Signatures" (low/medium/high).
multisigCreate.signersCountLimit: Note: Network limit (Stellar): max. 20 additional signers.
multisigCreate.signersInfo: Add G... addresses as signatories. Each signatory increases the minimum reserve.
multisigCreate.thresholdCurrent: Currently selected: low={{low}}, medium={{med}}, high={{high}} out of {{total}} signatures
multisigCreate.thresholdHelp: Threshold: The number of required signatures (master + signers) for a transaction to be valid.
multisigCreate.thresholdLevelsHint: Typically, the following applies: low = simple changes (e.g., memo, price), medium = payments/trading, high = security-critical changes (e.g., signer/thresholds).
multisigCreate.thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of the weights. Please adjust the values accordingly.
multisigCreate.title: Create account (optional Multisig)

tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the account holder (Master) (0-255): The master key of the account has a voting right. The higher its weight, the more votes its signature counts for. These votes are tallied together with those of other signers to determine if the required majority is reached.
tooltips.signerWeight: Signer weight (0–255): Additional signers also have voting rights. The weight determines how many votes their signature contributes. When a transaction is sent, all cast votes are added together. If the predetermined minimum number of votes (threshold) is reached, the transaction is considered authorized.
tooltips.signerWeightHint: Note: Master and signer weights form the total; thresholds (low/medium/high) must not exceed this total.

error.thresholdTooHigh: Thresholds must not exceed the sum of the weights.

multisigEdit.hint: Load an existing account, adjust signers, weights, master weight, and thresholds, and save the changes.
multisigEdit.menuHint: Adjusting signers/thresholds of an existing account
multisigEdit.noteMaxSigners: Note: Stellar allows a maximum of 20 additional signers per account.
multisigEdit.title: Edit multisig account

validation.signerKeyHint: Note: Signers must start with "G" (ed25519 public key).
validation.signerKeyInvalid: Invalid signer address. A G… address (ed25519) is expected.

secretKey.label: Enter the source secret key (will be securely sent to the backend)
secretKey.mismatch: Secret key does not match the public address.

remember.label: Remember the secret key for this session.
remember.hint: When activated, the key will be stored until the tab is closed and reused for further payments.

secretKey.clearSessionHint: Removes the secret key stored in this session (it will be deleted anyway when the tab is closed).

send.title: Send payment

info.none: No memo. Use this when the recipient does not expect a memo.
info.text: Free text up to 28 bytes. Often used for assignment in simple payments.
info.id: Numeric ID (uint64). Many exchanges use Memo ID for the allocation of deposits.
info.hash: 32-byte SHA-256 hash (as a 64-character hexadecimal string). Used by services for references.
info.return: 32-byte hash for returns. Used for returns (MEMO_RETURN).
